record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name=NULL and term="intromenu" and format.name=NULL and syslanguage="en"

brief.brief: The Menu Manager provides quick and easy access to existing Service Manager functions.
To access an existing function, click the option on a menu, press the option key, or type the Command string associated with the function in the Command line field, and press Enter.

detail.detail: MENUS
Open a menu by clicking to it on Service Manager Navigator or by clicking to if from higher menus.
To select a function, click the button.
OPTION KEYS
To identify the option key for an item on a menu bar, hover over it with your pointer.
When you press a valid Option Key, Service Manager runs that function.
If select an invalid Option, Service Manager responds with an error message.
COMMAND LINE
Specify the entire command exactly as stored in the menu record to run it.
If you enter an invalid command string, Service Manager responds with an error message.
For example, to access the Database Manager, type "db" at the Command line on any menu, and press Enter.
These command strings cause menu manager to perform special processing:
*m: Display a menu.
For example, "*mpmm" displays the Incident Management menu.
*f: Display a table (file) for editing.
For example, "*fenduser" displays the enduser table.
*a: Run an application.
For example, "*adatabase" runs the database application.
<string>: Search for commands starting with <string>.
If there is only one command, run it.
If there is than one command, display a list.
For example, "#db" displays a list of commands that start with "db".
Select a command to run it.
